intro: Hackelia patens, commonly known as the showy hackelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes, preferring well-drained soil. It has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces capsule fruits that release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Hackelia patens is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
